channel.title: Data Science Portfolio on Dylan Deppiesse
channel.description: Recent content in Data Science Portfolio on Dylan Deppiesse

item.title: Interview for SFU Economics
item.description: I was asked to do an interview with my former advisor from my days of being an economics student at SFU. I covered a variety of topics, including: Graduation and your first job Using LinkedIn to reach out to people Utilizing a university email Leaning on resources such as professors and advisors Working as a Data Analyst The project lifecycle: Working with stakeholders Gathering data to analyze Doing the analysis Presenting while being an introvert Adhoc requests and how to handle them

item.title: 2021 Goals
item.description: Similar to 2020, I’m going with 5 main goals that allow me flexibility in order to be happy with my accomplishments. 1 - Regular Meditation While I plan to eventually make this daily, my current goal is 5 days a week for at least 5 minutes each time. I started meditating at the end of 2020 and found it had all sorts of positives for my life. I was able to be more in touch with what was happening around me and live more in the moment, but also I started to understand what makes me feel certain ways.

item.title: 2020 Goals - Looking Back
item.description: Setting goals for 2020 was a fantastic idea and I’m grateful to the version of myself that decided to do this a year ago. These gave me direction and structure when I need it and also gave me enough flexibility to pivot and still feel that I completed what I wanted to. I didn’t meet all of my goals and I’m happy about that - it means that I made them challenging enough.

item.title: The Making of a COVID-19 Tableau Dashboard
item.description: Available at my Tableau Public: https://public.tableau.com/profile/dylan.deppiesse#!/vizhome/CanadaCovidCasesvsMovement/CasesandMovement My first “real” project in terms of finding a dataset and turning it into something. This is something that I’ve been saying I’ll do for a while now, and I finally forced myself to just start and see where it goes. Regardless of what the outcome was, I simply knew that starting 1 project would lead to working on more and improving as I went.

item.title: Creating this website
item.description: I never would have expected that trying to create a website to showcase my work would in itself become such a project. This is the first time that I have attempted to build something like this and I’m extremely happy with the result. I built this using Hugo, which allows for building static pages that can then be hosted on GitHub, which is what I have done. Not only was this my first foray into creating a site, it was also my first real use of GitHub - a skill which I’ve been wanting to learn for a while now.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Feel free to contact me on LinkedIn or view my Tableau Public LinkedIn: | https://www.linkedin.com/in/ddeppiesse/ Tableau Public: | https://public.tableau.com/profile/dylan.deppiesse
